entries.name: Mejoras de Característica
entries.description:
En el 5º nivel y cada 5 niveles posteriores, aumenta cuatro puntuaciones de habilidad diferentes. Puedes utilizar estos potenciadores para aumentar las puntuaciones de habilidad por encima de 18. Potenciar una puntuación de habilidad la aumenta en 1 si ya está en 18 o más, o en 2 si empieza por debajo de 18.

Tu eidolon también obtiene cuatro potenciadores de habilidad en estos niveles. Los potenciadores de habilidad del eidolón siguen las mismas reglas que los tuyos.

entries.name: Abjuración
entries.description: Como abjurador, dominas el arte de la protección, reforzando las defensas, impidiendo los ataques e incluso volviendo la magia contra sí misma. Entiendes que una onza de prevención vale más que una libra de cura. Añades un hechizo de abjuración de 1er nivel (como @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.TTwOKGqmZeKSyNMH]{Caída de Pluma}) a tu libro de hechizos. Aprendes el @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.lY9fOk1qBDDhBT8s]{Custodia Protectora} hechizo de la escuela.

entries.name: Golpes de adamantina
entries.description: Cuando concentras tu voluntad en tus miembros, tus golpes son tan inflexibles como el más duro de los metales. Tus ataques sin armas son tratados como adamantinos.

entries.name: Alquimia avanzada
entries.description:
Durante tus preparaciones diarias, después de producir nuevos @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.wySB9VHOW1v3TX1L]{Reactivos infundidos}, puedes gastar lotes de esos reactivos infundidos para crear objetos alquímicos infundidos.

No necesitas intentar un chequeo de Artesanía para hacer esto, e ignoras tanto el número de días típicamente requerido para crear los objetos como cualquier requisito de reactivos alquímicos.

Tu nivel de alquimia avanzada es igual a tu nivel. Por cada lote de reactivos infundidos que gastes, elige un objeto alquímico de tu nivel de alquimia avanzada o inferior que esté en tu libro de fórmulas, y haz un lote de dos de ese objeto.

Estos objetos tienen el rasgo infundido y permanecen potentes durante 24 horas o hasta tus siguientes preparaciones diarias, lo que ocurra primero.

entries.name: Escritura Avanzada
entries.description: Has aprendido una nueva y poderosa técnica del camino que elegiste. Obtienes la habilidad de escritura avanzada de la vía que elegiste a 1er nivel.

entries.name: Presteza Alquímica
entries.description: Tu comodidad a la hora de confeccionar objetos es tal que puedes crear tres a la vez. Cuando usas la acción @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.yzNJgwzV9XqEhKc6]{Alquimia rápida}, puedes gastar hasta tres lotes de reactivos infundidos para fabricar hasta tres objetos alquímicos como se describe en esa acción. Estos objetos no tienen que ser los mismos.

entries.name: Experiencia Alquímica
entries.description: La práctica constante ha aumentado la eficacia de tus brebajes. Tu rango de competencia para tu clase de alquimista DC aumenta a experto.

entries.name: Maestría Alquímica
entries.description: Tus brebajes alquímicos son increíblemente efectivos. Tu rango de competencia para tu clase de alquimista DC aumenta a maestro.

entries.name: Metodología de las ciencias alquímicas
entries.description:
Tu metodología hace hincapié en el análisis químico y alquímico, recogiendo información de partículas y fluidos inusuales encontrados en la escena. Posees suficientes conocimientos alquímicos para elaborar algunas tinturas que te ayuden en tus casos.

Estás entrenado en Artesanía y obtienes la hazaña @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.is3Oz9wt11lNq62K]{Artesanía alquímica}. Además, obtienes un @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.qCEOZ6109Yo34tRx]{Libro de fórmulas (en blanco)} gratis y aprendes las fórmulas de dos objetos alquímicos comunes adicionales de primer nivel, que deben ser elixires o herramientas. Cada vez que subes de nivel, aprendes la fórmula de un elixir alquímico común o una herramienta alquímica de cualquier nivel de objeto que puedas crear.

Durante tus preparaciones diarias, puedes crear un número de viales versátiles -concursos alquímicos que pueden convertirse rápidamente en elixires y herramientas- igual a tu modificador de Inteligencia. Puedes usar la acción @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.QHFMeJGzFWj2QczA]{Tintura rápida} para convertir uno de estos viales en un elixir o herramienta alquímica de la que conozcas la fórmula.

entries.name: Experiencia con las armas alquímicas
entries.description: Te has entrenado para manejar con mayor eficacia las armas que encuentras en tu laboratorio. Tus rangos de competencia en armas simples, ataques sin armas y bombas alquímicas aumentan a experto.

entries.name: Experiencia en armaduras de alquimista (nivel 13))
entries.description: Has aprendido a esquivar mientras llevas armadura media, ligera o sin armadura. Tus rangos de competencia en armadura media, armadura ligera y defensa sin armadura aumentan a experto.

entries.name: Maestría en armadura de alquimista (nivel 19)
entries.description: Tu habilidad con las armaduras ligeras y medias mejora, aumentando tu capacidad para esquivar golpes. Tus rangos de competencia en armadura media, armadura ligera y defensa sin armadura aumentan a maestro.

entries.name: Alquimia
entries.description:
Entiendes las complejas interacciones de las sustancias naturales y no naturales y puedes elaborar objetos alquímicos para satisfacer tus necesidades. Puedes hacerlo utilizando reactivos normales y la actividad Artesanía, o puedes utilizar reactivos especiales infundidos que te permiten elaborar objetos temporales rápidamente y sin coste alguno. Con el tiempo, puedes crear más y más objetos alquímicos de forma gratuita, y como cada uno de ellos se vuelve más y más poderoso, avanzas en poder de forma espectacular, dejando atrás a los que no entienden tu extraña ciencia.

Ganas la hazaña @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.is3Oz9wt11lNq62K]{Artesanía alquímica}, incluso si no cumples los prerrequisitos de esa hazaña, y ganas las cuatro fórmulas alquímicas comunes de 1er nivel otorgadas por esa hazaña. Puedes usar esta proeza para crear objetos alquímicos siempre que tengas las fórmulas de los objetos en tu libro de fórmulas.

entries.name: Alerta
entries.description: La experiencia te ha hecho cada vez más consciente de las amenazas que te rodean, y reaccionas más rápidamente ante el peligro. Tu rango de competencia en Percepción aumenta a experto.

entries.name: Anatema (Clérigo)
entries.description:
Los actos fundamentalmente opuestos al alineamiento o los ideales de tu deidad son anatema para tu fe. Aprender o lanzar hechizos, cometer actos y usar objetos que son anatema para tu deidad te aleja de la gracia de tu deidad.

Lanzar hechizos con el rasgo maligno es casi siempre un anatema para las deidades buenas, y lanzar hechizos buenos es igualmente un anatema para las deidades malignas; del mismo modo, lanzar hechizos caóticos es un anatema para las deidades legales, y lanzar hechizos legales es un anatema para las deidades caóticas. Un clérigo neutral que adora a una deidad neutral no está limitado de esta manera, pero su alineamiento puede cambiar con el tiempo si frecuentemente lanza hechizos o usa habilidades con un determinado alineamiento. Del mismo modo, el lanzamiento de hechizos que son anatema a los principios u objetivos de su fe podría interferir con su conexión con su deidad. Por ejemplo, lanzar un hechizo para crear muertos vivientes sería anatema para @Compendium[pf2e.deities.QZD0u1jxwz0kj8uI]{Pharasma}, la diosa de la muerte. Para los casos límite, tú y tu GM determináis qué actos son anatema.

Si realizas suficientes actos que son anatema para tu deidad, o si tu alineamiento cambia a uno no permitido por tu deidad, pierdes las habilidades mágicas que provienen de tu conexión con tu deidad. Las características de clase que pierdes las determina el GM, pero probablemente incluyan tu fuente divina y todos los hechizos divinos. Estas habilidades sólo se pueden recuperar si demuestras tu arrepentimiento realizando una @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.7Fd4lxozd11MQ55N]{expiar} ritual.

entries.name: Anatema (Druid)
entries.description:
Como administradores del orden natural, los druidas consideran anatema las afrentas a la naturaleza. Si realizas suficientes actos que son anatema para la naturaleza, pierdes tus habilidades mágicas que provienen de la clase druida, incluyendo tu lanzamiento de hechizos primarios y los beneficios de tu orden. Estas habilidades sólo se pueden recuperar si demuestras tu arrepentimiento realizando un @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.7Fd4lxozd11MQ55N]{expiar} ritual.

Los siguientes actos son anatema para todos los druidas:

  • Utilizar armaduras o escudos metálicos.
  • Explotación de lugares naturales.
  • Enseñar el lenguaje druídico a los no druidas.

Cada orden druídica tiene también actos anatema adicionales, detallados en la entrada de la orden.

Consulte las ordenes específicas para obtener más información.

entries.name: Ancestros
entries.description:
Las voces de las generaciones pasadas te hablan, y tú escuchas sus palabras. Puede que te moleste la constante interrupción, o puede que reverencies los espíritus de los que vinieron antes. Tal vez procedas de una cultura con fuertes tradiciones ancestrales, como los Shoanti Skoan-Quah (Clan de la Calavera), una comunidad tradicional de enanos que rinde culto al panteón familiar de Torag, o un grupo que venera a Erastil o Pharasma. Puedes entrar en comunión con poderosos psicopompos que guían a las almas hacia el más allá, con el propio Río de las Almas o con aquellos espíritus que han quedado atrapados fuera del gran ciclo de renacimiento espiritual. Aprendes de sus susurros y de los fragmentos de sus recuerdos, pero abrir tu mente a sus conocimientos y experiencias también les permite inmiscuirse en tus asuntos mundanos.

Beneficio misterioso

Los susurros de tus antepasados te han otorgado conocimientos adicionales. Obtienes una proeza de ascendencia adicional a 1er nivel y otra proeza de ascendencia adicional a 11º nivel. Estas proezas no pueden ser las que otorgan efectos fisiológicos, como sentidos adicionales o ataques desarmados.

Habilidad entrenada Society

Truco concedido @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.izcxFQFwf3woCnFs]{orientación divina}

Hechizos de revelación

  • Inicial @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.d2pi7laQkzlr3wrS]{Toque ancestral};
  • Avanzados @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.J5KrjQKCg2PrF1vz]{Defensa ancestral};
  • Greater @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.xEjGEBvTfDJECSki]{Forma ancestral}

Dominios relacionados muerte, familia

Maldición de la intromisión ancestral

@Compendium[pf2e.feature-effects.V6lnFOq998B76Rr0]{Efecto: Maldición ancestral}

Los espíritus ancestrales con los que comulgas te persiguen y se inmiscuyen en tus pertenencias y acciones, ya sea por un intento bienintencionado (pero en última instancia perjudicial) de ayudarte, como castigo por tu audacia a la hora de eludir los medios tradicionales de conseguir el poder divino, para divertirse, o una mezcla de todo ello. Tu pelo, tu ropa y tus pertenencias se mueven constantemente, aparentemente por voluntad propia.

Maldición menor

Uno de tus ancestros se vuelve predominante en su intromisión. La primera vez que obtienes este efecto cada día, tira [[/r 1d4]] en la lista de abajo para determinar qué tipo de ancestro se vuelve predominante. Este ancestro predominante te guía para utilizar su tipo de acción preferido. Cuando intentas usar uno de los tipos de acciones de la lista para los otros ancestros, debes tener éxito en un chequeo plano DC 4. Si fallas, gastas la acción pero no obtienes ningún efecto (aunque no pierdes el hechizo si estabas lanzando un hechizo). Si tu acción tarda 1 minuto o más, es lo suficientemente larga como para que puedas superar la intromisión, y no necesitas intentar un chequeo plano.

Durante el combate u otro encuentro tenso, ronda a ronda, otros ancestros luchan por el control de tus acciones. Cuando tires la iniciativa, y luego al final de cada uno de tus turnos durante el encuentro, tira [[/r 1d4]] y cambia tu ancestro predominante apropiadamente. Una vez que el encuentro termina, vuelves a la influencia del ancestro que tiraste por primera vez para el día.

Maldición moderada

La DC del chequeo plano para usar otras acciones es 6, y obtienes el beneficio de la maldición moderada listada para tu ancestro predominante en la lista de abajo.

Maldición mayor (11th)

La DC del chequeo plano es 8, y obtienes el beneficio de maldición mayor listado para tu ancestro predominante en lugar del beneficio de maldición moderada.

Influencia de los ancestros

  1. Ancestro marcial
    • Acción preferida Golpes
    • Beneficio moderado de la maldición Tus golpes ganan un bono de estado de +1 a las tiradas de ataque y un bono de estado de +2 al daño.
    • Mayor beneficio de la maldición Tus golpes ganan un bono de estado de +1 a las tiradas de ataque y un bono de estado de +6 al daño
  2. Antepasado hábil
    • Acción preferida Acciones de percepción y destreza
    • Beneficio moderado de la maldición Obtienes un bono de estado de +1 a los chequeos de habilidad y a los chequeos de Percepción.
    • Mayor beneficio de la maldición Obtienes un bonificador de estado +2 a los chequeos de habilidad y a los chequeos de Percepción.
  3. Ancestro hechicero
    • Acción preferida Lanzar un hechizo
    • Beneficio moderado de la maldición Los hechizos sin duración que no sean de tipo cantrip ganan un bono de estado a su daño y curación igual al nivel del hechizo.
    • Mayor beneficio de la maldición Los hechizos sin duración que no sean de trucos ganan un bono de estado a su daño y curación igual al nivel del hechizo + 3.
  4. Tú eliges qué ancestro guía tus acciones

entries.name: Misterio de los ancestros(Multiclase)
entries.description:
The voices of generations past speak to you, and you hear their words. You might resent the constant interruption, or you might revere the spirits of those who came before. Perhaps you hail from a culture with strong ancestral traditions, such as the Shoanti Skoan-Quah (Skull Clan), a traditional dwarven community that worships Torag's family pantheon, or a group that reveres Erastil or Pharasma. You might commune with powerful psychopomps who shepherd souls to the afterlife, with the River of Souls itself, or with those spirits who have become trapped outside of the great cycle of spiritual rebirth. You learn from their whispers and the fragments of their memories, but opening your mind to their knowledge and experience also allows them to meddle in your worldly affairs.

Curse of Ancestral Meddling

The ancestral spirits you commune with haunt you and meddle with your belongings and actions, either out of a well-intentioned (but ultimately detrimental) attempt to assist you, as punishment for your audacity in circumventing the traditional means of achieving divine power, for their own amusement, or a mixture of the above. Your hair, clothing, and belongings constantly shift and stir, seemingly of their own volition.

entries.name: Animal Instinct
entries.description:
The fury of a wild predator fills you when you Rage, granting you ferocious unarmed attacks. Cultures that revere vicious animals (such as apes or bears) give rise to barbarians with this instinct. You might also be at war with an uncontrollable, animalistic side of your personality, or you might be a descendant of a werewolf or another werecreature. Select an animal from Table 3-3: Animal Instincts that best matches your chosen animal.

Table 3-3: Animal Instincts

Animal Attack Damage Traits
@Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.vlRvOQS1HZZqSyh7]{Ape} Fist 1d10 B Grapple, unarmed
@Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.uGY2yddm8mZx8Yo2]{Bear} Jaws 1d10 P Unarmed
Bear (continued) Claw 1d6 S Agile, unarmed
@Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.31sPXwmEbbcvgsM9]{Bull} Horn 1d10 P Shove, unarmed
@Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.vCNtX2LwlemhA3tu]{Cat} Jaws 1d10 P Unarmed
Cat (continued) Claw 1d6 S Agile, unarmed
@Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.RQUJgDjJODO775qb]{Deer} Antler 1d10 P Grapple, unarmed
@Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.CXZwt1e6ManeBaFV]{Frog} Jaws 1d10 B Unarmed
Frog (continued) Tongue 1d4 B Agile, unarmed
@Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.OJmI1L4dhQfz8vze]{Shark} Jaws 1d10 P Grapple, unarmed
@Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.pIYWMCNnYDQfSRQh]{Snake} Fangs 1d10 P Grapple, unarmed
@Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.xX6KnYYgHlPGoTG6]{Wolf} Jaws 1d10 P Trip, unarmed

Anathema

Flagrantly disrespecting an animal of your chosen kind is anathema to your instinct, as is using weapons while raging.

Bestial Rage (Instinct Ability)

When you Rage, you gain your chosen animal's unarmed attack (or attacks). The specific attack gained, the damage it deals, and its traits are listed on Table 3-3: Animal Instincts. These attacks are in the brawling group. Your Rage action gains the morph, primal, and transmutation traits.

Specialization Ability

Increase the damage die size for the unarmed attacks granted by your chosen animal by one step, and increase the additional damage from Rage from 2 to 5 for your chosen animal's unarmed attacks. The frog's tongue attack and deer's antler attack gain reach 10 feet. If you have greater weapon specialization, increase the damage from Rage from 5 to 12 for your chosen animal's unarmed attacks.

Raging Resistance

You resist piercing and slashing damage.

entries.name: Animal Order
entries.description: You have a strong connection to beasts, and you are allied with a beast companion. You are trained in Athletics. You also gain the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.f2Pl5dWEL9ZvEyI1]{Animal Companion (Druid)} druid feat. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Zmh4ynfnCtwKeAYl]{Heal Animal} order spell. Committing wanton cruelty to animals or killing animals unnecessarily is anathema to your order. (This doesn't prevent you from defending yourself against animals or killing them cleanly for food.)

entries.name: Antipaladin
entries.description:
You're dishonorable, dishonest, and committed to breaking the false hopes of kindness. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.r5Uth6yvCoE4tr9z]{Destructive Vengeance} champion's reaction and the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.jFmWSIpJGGebim6y]{Touch of Corruption} devotion spell. After the tenets of evil, add these tenets.

  • You must not bind yourself with any law or oath beyond that of your code (though you can still select a champion feat with the oath trait). Act dishonorably, take advantage of others, lie, cheat, and steal to get what you want.
  • You must destroy that which offends you and that which stands in your way, including-and perhaps especially-the forces of good and law that oppose you. This tenet doesn't force you to take action immediately if it could mean your destruction, nor does it require you to destroy something that might be useful if corrupted toward your ends.

Champion's Reaction

@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.r5Uth6yvCoE4tr9z]{Destructive Vengeance} r

Trigger An enemy within 15 feet damages you

Bloodshed begets bloodshed as you drag your enemy toward oblivion. You increase the amount of damage you take by 1d6, and you deal 1d6 damage to the triggering enemy, choosing evil or negative damage to deal to the enemy each time you use this reaction. In addition, until the end of your next turn, your @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strikes} against the triggering creature deal 2 extra damage of the type you chose.

The damage you take and deal when you use this reaction increases to 2d6 at 5th level, 3d6 at 9th level, 4d6 at 12th level, 5d6 at 16th level, and 6d6 at 19th level. The extra damage on your Strikes increases to 4 at 9th level and 6 at 16th level.

Divine SmiteLevel 9

An enemy damaged by the initial damage from your Destructive Vengeance also takes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Evil Damage} equal to your Charisma modifier. This applies only to the damage the reaction itself deals to the triggering creature, not the damage you deal with subsequent @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strikes}.

ExaltLevel 11

When you use Destructive Vengeance, each enemy within 15 feet of you other than the triggering creature takes half the damage you deal to the triggering enemy, of the same damage type you chose.

entries.name: Ape Animal Instinct
entries.description:
The fury of a wild predator fills you when you Rage, granting you ferocious unarmed attacks. Cultures that revere vicious animals (such as apes or bears) give rise to barbarians with this instinct. You might also be at war with an uncontrollable, animalistic side of your personality, or you might be a descendant of a werewolf or another werecreature.

  • Ape Instinct
    • Fist (Grapple, Unarmed) 1d10 Bludgeoning

Anathema

Flagrantly disrespecting an animal of your chosen kind is anathema to your instinct, as is using weapons while raging.

Bestial Rage (Instinct Ability)

When you Rage, you gain your chosen animal's unarmed attack (or attacks). The specific attack gained, the damage it deals, and its traits are listed on Table 3-3: Animal Instincts. These attacks are in the brawling group. Your Rage action gains the morph, primal, and transmutation traits.

Specialization Ability

Increase the damage die size for the unarmed attacks granted by your chosen animal by one step, and increase the additional damage from Rage from 2 to 5 for your chosen animal's unarmed attacks. The frog's tongue attack and deer's antler attack gain reach 10 feet. If you have greater weapon specialization, increase the damage from Rage from 5 to 12 for your chosen animal's unarmed attacks.

Raging Resistance

You resist piercing and slashing damage.

entries.name: Arcane Bond
entries.description: You place some of your magical power in a bonded item. Each day when you prepare your spells, you can designate a single item you own as your bonded item. This is typically an item associated with spellcasting, such as a wand, ring, or staff, but you are free to designate a weapon or other item. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.v82XtjAVN4ffgVVR]{Drain Bonded Item} free action.

entries.name: Arcane Cascade
entries.description:
After you wield magic, you can enter a special stance to make your attacks more effective.

@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.HbejhIywqIufrmVM]{Arcane Cascade}

entries.name: Arcane School
entries.description:
Many arcane spellcasters delve deeply into a single school of magic in an attempt to master its secrets. If you want to be a specialist wizard, choose a school in which to specialize. You gain additional spells and spell slots for spells of your school.

If you don't choose a school, you're a universalist, a wizard who believes the path to true knowledge of magic requires a multidisciplinary understanding of all eight schools working together. Though a universalist lacks the focus of a specialist wizard, they have greater flexibility.

entries.name: Arcane Spellcasting (Magus)
entries.description:
You study spells so you can combine them with your attacks or solve problems that strength of arms alone can't handle. You can cast arcane spells using the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.aBQ8ajvEBByv45yz]{Cast a Spell} activity, and you can supply material, somatic, and verbal components when casting spells.

Because you're a magus, you can draw replacement sigils with the tip of your weapon or your free hand for spells requiring material components, replacing them with somatic components instead of needing a material component pouch.

At 1st level, you can prepare one 1st-level spell and five cantrips each morning from the spells in your spellbook. Prepared spells remain available to you until you cast them or until you prepare your spells again. The number of spells you can prepare is called your spell slots.

As you increase in level as a magus, your number of spell slots and the highest level of spells you can cast from spell slots increase. Because you split your focus between physical training and magical scholarship, you have no more than two spell slots of your highest level and, if you can cast 2nd-level spells or higher, two spell slots of 1 level lower than your highest spell level.

Some of your spells require you to attempt a spell attack roll to see how effective they are, or have your enemies roll against your spell DC (typically by attempting a saving throw). Your spell attack rolls and spell DCs use your Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Arcane Spellcasting (Wizard)
entries.description:
Through dedicated study and practice, you can harness arcane power to cast spells. You can cast arcane spells using the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.aBQ8ajvEBByv45yz]{Cast a Spell} activity, and you can supply material, somatic, and verbal components when casting spells.

At 1st level, you can prepare up to two 1st-level spells and five cantrips each morning from the spells in your spellbook, plus one extra cantrip and spell of your chosen school of each level you can cast if you are a specialist wizard. Prepared spells remain available to you until you cast them or until you prepare your spells again. The number of spells you can prepare is called your spell slots.

As you increase in level as a wizard, your number of spell slots and the highest level of spells you can cast from spell slots increase.

entries.name: Arcane Thesis
entries.description: During your studies to become a full-fledged wizard, you produced a thesis of unique magical research on one of a variety of topics. You gain a special benefit depending on the topic of your thesis research. The arcane thesis topics presented in this book are below; your specific thesis probably has a much longer and more technical title like "On the Methods of Spell Interpolation and the Genesis of a New Understanding of the Building Blocks of Magic."

entries.name: Archwizard's Spellcraft
entries.description: You command the most potent arcane magic and can cast a spell of truly incredible power. You gain a single 10th-level spell slot and can prepare a spell in that slot using arcane spellcasting. You can't use this spell slot for abilities that let you cast spells without expending spell slots or that give you more spell slots. Unlike with other spell slots, you don't gain more 10th-level spells as you level up, though you can take the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.tP26mgaFPpr6df1i]{Archwizard's Might} feat to gain a second slot.

entries.name: Armor Expertise
entries.description: You have spent so much time in armor that you know how to make the most of its protection. Your proficiency ranks for light, medium, and heavy armor, as well as for unarmored defense, increase to expert. You gain the armor specialization effects of medium and heavy armor.

entries.name: Armor Mastery
entries.description: Your skill with armor improves, helping you avoid more blows. Your proficiency ranks for light, medium, and heavy armor, as well as for unarmored defense, increase to master.

entries.name: Armor of Fury
entries.description: Your training and rage deepen your connection to your armor. Your proficiency ranks for light armor, medium armor, and unarmored defense increase to master.

entries.name: Attack of Opportunity
entries.description: Ever watchful for weaknesses, you can quickly attack foes that leave an opening in their defenses. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.KAVf7AmRnbCAHrkT]{Attack of Opportunity} reaction.

entries.name: Baba Yaga Patron
entries.description:
Baba Yaga teaches you how to transfer spirits into objects and freeze your foes.

Spell List occult

Patron Skill Occultism

Hex Cantrip @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.yp4w9SG4RuqRM8KD]{Spirit Object}

Granted Spell @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.8TQiFzGf4feoHeH0]{Chilling Spray}

entries.name: Bard Weapon Expertise
entries.description: You have become thoroughly adept with bardic weapons. You gain expert proficiency in simple weapons and unarmed attacks, plus the longsword, rapier, sap, shortbow, shortsword, and whip. When you critically succeed at an attack roll using one of these weapons while one of your compositions is active, you apply the critical specialization effect for that weapon.

entries.name: Battle
entries.description:
Warlike forces fill you with physical might and tactical knowledge, aiming to have you uphold the glory of combat, fight to improve the world, prepare against the necessity of conflict, or endure the inevitability of war. You might draw upon deities such as Gorum, Iomedae, Rovagug, the Horseman of War Szuriel, the Queen of the Night Eiseth, the Vudrani god Diomazul, and others, or you might find power in the unending conflict between the armies of Heaven and Hell, the Elemental Planes, the Outer Gods, or even the collective spirits of those who fought in wars over the ages.

Mystery Benefit

You are no stranger to the trappings of warfare. You are trained in medium and heavy armor. At 13th level, if you gain the light armor expertise class feature, you also gain expert proficiency in these armors.

Choose one weapon group that embodies your mystery. You are trained in all martial weapons of that group. At 11th level, if you gain the weapon expertise class feature, you also gain expert proficiency for martial weapons in your chosen group, and you become trained in advanced weapons in that group.

Trained Skill Athletics

Granted Cantrip @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.TVKNbcgTee19PXZR]{Shield}

Revelation Spells

  • Initial @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.dqaCLzINHBiKjh4J]{Call to Arms};
  • Advanced @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.2jWVNdVlbJq84dfT]{Battlefield Persistence};
  • Greater @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.4j0FQ1mkidBAXuQV]{Heroic Feat}

Related Domains might, zeal

Curse of the Hero's Burden

@Compendium[pf2e.feature-effects.pQ3EjUm1lZW9t3el]{Effect: Battle Curse}

You thrive while adrenaline flows and your life depends on your might alone, but holding the collective battle prowess of the ages within you leaves your body weakened after a fight. You smell faintly of steel and blood no matter how you try to remove or mask the scent, you appear more muscular than you actually are, and you hear the faint clash and clamor of battle in the distance at all times.

Minor Curse

Your body languishes when you aren't bringing harm to your foes. You take a -2 status penalty to AC and saving throws, but each time you make a Strike, you can suspend these penalties until the start of your next turn.

Moderate Curse

The strain of conflict wears upon your body, even though you gain vitality from it. Making a Strike reduces the penalty from your minor curse to -1 rather than suspending it entirely. You gain a +2 status bonus to weapon and unarmed damage rolls. You also gain fast healing equal to half your level while in a non-trivial combat encounter.

Major Curse (11th)

Your body proves capable of truly heroic feats, but doing so interferes with your mental focus. Your moderate curse's fast healing is equal to your level, and its damage bonus is +6. You gain a +1 status bonus to weapon and unarmed attack rolls, but you are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}.

entries.name: Battle Mystery (Multiclass)
entries.description:
Warlike forces fill you with physical might and tactical knowledge, aiming to have you uphold the glory of combat, fight to improve the world, prepare against the necessity of conflict, or endure the inevitability of war. You might draw upon deities such as Gorum, Iomedae, Rovagug, the Horseman of War Szuriel, the Queen of the Night Eiseth, the Vudrani god Diomazul, and others, or you might find power in the unending conflict between the armies of Heaven and Hell, the Elemental Planes, the Outer Gods, or even the collective spirits of those who fought in wars over the ages.

Curse of the Hero's Burden

You thrive while adrenaline flows and your life depends on your might alone, but holding the collective battle prowess of the ages within you leaves your body weakened after a fight. You smell faintly of steel and blood no matter how you try to remove or mask the scent, you appear more muscular than you actually are, and you hear the faint clash and clamor of battle in the distance at all times.

entries.name: Battledancer
entries.description:
To you, a fight is a kind of performance art, and you command your foes' attention with mesmerizing motions.

You are trained in Performance and gain the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.7LB00jkh6JaJr3vS]{Fascinating Performance} skill feat. You gain @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.LzYi0OuOoypNb6jd]{Panache} during an encounter when the result of your Performance check to Perform exceeds the Will DC of an observing foe, even if the foe isn't fascinated.

entries.name: Battlefield Surveyor
entries.description: Whether taking stock of an enemy army or simply standing guard, you excel at observing your foes. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to master. In addition, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks for initiative, making you faster to react during combat.

entries.name: Bear Animal Instinct
entries.description:
The fury of a wild predator fills you when you Rage, granting you ferocious unarmed attacks. Cultures that revere vicious animals (such as apes or bears) give rise to barbarians with this instinct. You might also be at war with an uncontrollable, animalistic side of your personality, or you might be a descendant of a werewolf or another werecreature.

  • Bear Instinct
    • Jaws (Unarmed) 1d10 Piercing
    • Claw (Agile, Unarmed) 1d6 Slashing

Anathema

Flagrantly disrespecting an animal of your chosen kind is anathema to your instinct, as is using weapons while raging.

Bestial Rage (Instinct Ability)

When you Rage, you gain your chosen animal's unarmed attack (or attacks). The specific attack gained, the damage it deals, and its traits are listed on Table 3-3: Animal Instincts. These attacks are in the brawling group. Your Rage action gains the morph, primal, and transmutation traits.

Specialization Ability

Increase the damage die size for the unarmed attacks granted by your chosen animal by one step, and increase the additional damage from Rage from 2 to 5 for your chosen animal's unarmed attacks. The frog's tongue attack and deer's antler attack gain reach 10 feet. If you have greater weapon specialization, increase the damage from Rage from 5 to 12 for your chosen animal's unarmed attacks.

Raging Resistance

You resist piercing and slashing damage.

entries.name: Black Dragon Instinct
entries.description:
You summon the fury of a mighty dragon and manifest incredible abilities. Perhaps your culture reveres draconic majesty, or you gained your connection by drinking or bathing in dragon's blood or after watching a marauding wyrm burn your village.

  • Black Dragon
    • Type Chromatic
    • Breath Weapon Line of Acid

Anathema

Letting a personal insult against you slide is anathema to your instinct. Choose whether your character respects or abhors your dragon type. If you respect it, defying such a dragon is anathema, and if you abhor it, failing to defeat such a dragon you come across is anathema.

Draconic Rage (Instinct Ability)

While raging, you can increase the additional damage from Rage from 2 to 4 and change its damage type to match that of your dragon's breath weapon instead of the damage type for your weapon or unarmed attack. If you do this, your Rage action gains the arcane and evocation traits, as well as the trait matching the damage type.

Specialization Ability

When you use draconic rage, you increase the additional damage from Rage from 4 to 8. If you have greater weapon specialization, instead increase the damage from Rage when using draconic rage from 8 to 16.

Raging Resistance

You resist piercing damage and the damage type of your dragon's breath weapon.

entries.name: Bloodline
entries.description:
Choose a bloodline that gives you your spellcasting talent. This choice determines the type of spells you cast and the spell list you choose them from, additional spells you learn, and additional trained skills. You also gain Focus Points and special focus spells based on your bloodline. The bloodlines presented are as follows:

  • @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.3qqvnC2U8W26yae7]{Aberrant} A strange and unknowable influence gives you occult spells.
  • @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.vhW3glAaEfq2DKrw]{Angelic} Holy grace bestows divine spells upon you.
  • @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.w5koctOVrEcpxTIq]{Demonic} A sinful corruption gives you divine spells.
  • @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.o39zQMIdERWtmBSB]{Diabolic} A bond with devils gives you divine spells.
  • @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.ZHabYxSgYK0XbjhM]{Draconic} The blood of dragons grants you arcane spells.
  • @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.RXRnJcG4XSabZ35a]{Elemental} The power of the elements manifests in you as primal spells.
  • @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.eW3cfCH7Wpx2vik2]{Fey} Influence from the fey gives you primal spells.
  • @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.tYOMBiH3HbViNWwn]{Genie} Through lineage, magic, or wishes made real, the blood of a noble genie flows through your veins.
  • @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.O0uXZRWMNliDbkxU]{Hag} The blight of a hag has given you occult spells.
  • @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.ZEtJJ5UOlV5oTWWp]{Imperial} An ancient power grants you arcane spells.
  • @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.5Wxjghw7lHuCxjZz]{Nymph} One of your ancestors was inspired by a nymph, or perhaps was a nymph themself, and now the beauty of nature lives in you.
  • @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.TWR1wbPJuCLnGdFZ]{Phoenix} The healing fire a phoenix's blessing grants you primal spells.
  • @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.PpzH9tJULk5ksX9w]{Psychopomp} For good or ill, your ancestors' deeds drew the attention of psychopomps, or you might somehow count one in your family tree. The presence of these shepherds of souls and enemies of undeath has left an indelible mark on you.
  • @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.uoQOm41BVdSo6pAS]{Shadow} Whether due to a velstrac's manipulations or a planar jaunt gone horribly wrong, your bloodline was infused with a vein of shadow.
  • @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.7WBZ2kkhZ7JorWu2]{Undead} The touch of death gives you divine spells.
  • @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.dKTb959aCQIzSIXj]{Wyrmblessed} A draconic blessing grants you divine spells.

entries.name: Bloodline Paragon
entries.description: You have perfected the magic in your bloodline. Add two common 10th-level spells of your tradition to your repertoire. You gain a single 10th-level spell slot you can use to cast these spells, using sorcerer spellcasting. Unlike other spell slots, you don't gain more 10th-level spells as you level up, and they can't be used for abilities that let you cast spells without expending spell slots or abilities that give you more spell slots. You can take the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.6SEDoht4dXEJE5SW]{Bloodline Perfection} sorcerer feat to gain a second slot.

entries.name: Bloodline Spells
entries.description:
Your bloodline grants you bloodline spells, special spells unique to your lineage. Bloodline spells are a type of focus spell. It costs 1 Focus Point to cast a focus spell, and you start with a focus pool of 1 Focus Point. You refill your focus pool during your daily preparations, and you can regain 1 Focus Point by spending 10 minutes using the Refocus activity. Unlike other characters, you don't need to do anything specific to Refocus, as the power flowing through your veins naturally replenishes your focus pool.

Focus spells are automatically heightened to half your level rounded up. Focus spells don't require spell slots, nor can you cast them using spell slots. Taking feats can give you more focus spells and increase the size of your focus pool, though your focus pool can never hold more than 3 points. The full rules can be found here.

Reading A Bloodline Entry

A bloodline entry contains the following information:

Spell List You use this magical tradition and spell list.

Bloodline Skills You become trained in the listed skills.

Granted Spells You automatically add the spells listed here to your spell repertoire, as described in the Spell Repertoire class feature. At 1st level, you gain a cantrip and a 1st-level spell. You learn the other spells on the list as soon as you gain the ability to cast sorcerer spells of that level.

Bloodline Spells You automatically gain the initial bloodline spell at 1st level and can gain more by selecting the Advanced Bloodline and Greater Bloodline feats.

Blood Magic Whenever you cast a bloodline spell using Focus Points or a granted spell from your bloodline using a spell slot, you gain a blood magic effect. If the blood magic offers a choice, make it before resolving the spell. The blood magic effect occurs after resolving any checks for the spell's initial effects and, against a foe, applies only if the spell is a successful attack or the foe fails its saving throw. If the spell has an area, you must designate yourself or one target in the area when you cast the spell to be the target of the blood magic effect. All references to spell level refer to the level of the spell you cast.

entries.name: Bloodline: Aberrant
entries.description:
Something speaks to you from beyond the stars or below the earth. Ancient and unknowable, this alien influence presses against your mind.

Spell List occult

Bloodline Skills Intimidation, Occultism

Granted Spells cantrip @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.4gBIw4IDrSfFHik4]{Daze}, 1st: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.DYdvMZ8G2LiSLVWw]{Spider Sting}, 2nd: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.CQb8HtQ1BPeZmu9h]{Touch of Idiocy}, 3rd: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.N1Z1oLPdBxaSgrEE]{Vampiric Touch}, 4th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.LiGbewa9pO0yjbsY]{Confusion}, 5th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.2w4OpAGihn1JSHFD]{Black Tentacles}, 6th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.5BbU1V6wGSGbrmRD]{Feeblemind}, 7th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.8kJbiBEjMWG4VUjs]{Warp Mind}, 8th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Jvyy6oVIQsD34MHB]{Uncontrollable Dance}, 9th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Ht35SDf9PDStJfoC]{Spirit Song}

Bloodline Spells initial: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.i8PBZsnoCrK7IWph]{Tentacular Limbs}, advanced: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.qhJfRnkCRrMI4G1O]{Aberrant Whispers}, greater: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.ddKBoCjmSyPSHcws]{Unusual Anatomy}

Blood Magic Aberrant whispers shield one target's mind or your own, granting a +2 status bonus to Will saving throws for 1 round.

@Compendium[pf2e.feature-effects.UQ7vZgmfK0VSFS8A]{Effect: Aberrant Blood Magic}

entries.name: Bloodline: Angelic
entries.description:
One of your forebears hailed from a celestial realm, or your ancestors' devotion led to their lineage being blessed.

Spell List divine

Bloodline Skills Diplomacy, Religion

Granted Spells cantrip @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Light}, 1st: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal}, 2nd: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Fq9yCbqI2RDt6Orw]{Spiritual Weapon}, 3rd: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.DyiD239dNS7RIxZE]{Searing Light}, 4th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.hVU9msO9yGkxKZ3J]{Divine Wrath}, 5th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.E3X2RbzWHCdz7gsk]{Flame Strike}, 6th:@Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.peCF6VArm8urfwxZ]{Blade Barrier}, 7th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.sX2o0HH4RjJDAZ8C]{Divine Decree}, 8th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.nsQvjNyg4Whw2mek]{Divine Aura}, 9th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.qsNeG9KZpODSACMq]{Foresight}

Bloodline Spells initial: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.w3uGXDVEdbLFZVO0]{Angelic Halo}, advanced: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.kRsmUlSWhi6PJvZ7]{Angelic Wings}, greater: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.9WlTR9JlEcjRmGiD]{Celestial Brand}

Blood Magic An angelic aura protects you or one target, granting a +1 status bonus to saving throws for 1 round.

@Compendium[pf2e.feature-effects.s1tulrmW6teTFjVd]{Effect: Angelic Blood Magic}

entries.name: Bloodline: Demonic
entries.description:
Demons debase all they touch. One of your ancestors fell victim to their corruption, and you are burdened by that sin.

Spell List divine

Bloodline Skills Intimidation, Religion

Granted Spells cantrip @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.gISYsBFby1TiXfBt]{Acid Splash}, 1st: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.4koZzrnMXhhosn0D]{Fear}, 2nd: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.wzctak6BxOW8xvFV]{Enlarge}, 3rd: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.WsUwpfmhKrKwoIe3]{Slow}, 4th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.hVU9msO9yGkxKZ3J]{Divine Wrath}, 5th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.vJuaxTd6q11OjGqA]{Abyssal Plague}, 6th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]{Disintegrate}, 7th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.sX2o0HH4RjJDAZ8C]{Divine Decree}, 8th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.nsQvjNyg4Whw2mek]{Divine Aura}, 9th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.4WS7HrFjwNvTn8T2]{Implosion}

Bloodline Spells initial: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.SdXFiQ4Py8761sNO]{Glutton's Jaw}, advanced: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.iQD8OhhkwhvD8Blw]{Swamp of Sloth}, greater: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.crF4g9jRN1y84MSD]{Abyssal Wrath}

Blood Magic The corruption of sin weakens a target's defenses or makes you more imposing. Either a target takes a -1 status penalty to AC for 1 round, or you gain a +1 status bonus to Intimidation checks for 1 round.

@Compendium[pf2e.feature-effects.aKRo5TIhUtu0kyEr]{Effect: Demonic Blood Magic (Self)}, @Compendium[pf2e.feature-effects.yfbP64r4a9e5oyli]{Effect: Demonic Blood Magic (Target)}

entries.name: Bloodline: Diabolic
entries.description:
Devils are evil with a silver tongue, and one of your ancestors dallied in darkness or made an infernal pact.

Spell List divine

Bloodline Skills Deception, Religion

Granted Spells cantrip @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.O9w7r4BKgPogYDDe]{Produce Flame}, 1st: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm}, 2nd: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.2ZdHjnpEQJuqOYSG]{Flaming Sphere}, 3rd: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.IihxWhRfpsBgQ5jS]{Enthrall}, 4th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Suggestion}, 5th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.GaRQlC9Yw1BGKHfN]{Crushing Despair}, 6th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.uqlxMQQeSGWEVjki]{True Seeing}, 7th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.sX2o0HH4RjJDAZ8C]{Divine Decree}, 8th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.nsQvjNyg4Whw2mek]{Divine Aura}, 9th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.jrBa9deU2ULFWvSl]{Meteor Swarm}

Bloodline Spells initial: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Vctwx1ewa8HUOA94]{Diabolic Edict}, advanced: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.ilGsyGLGjjIPHbyP]{Embrace the Pit}, greater: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.9LHr9SuDLTicdbXs]{Hellfire Plume}

Blood Magic Hellfire scorches a target or fills your tongue with lies. Either a target takes 1 fire damage per spell level (if the spell already deals initial fire damage, combine this with the spell's initial damage before determining weaknesses and resistances), or you gain a +1 status bonus to Deception checks for 1 round.

@Compendium[pf2e.feature-effects.n1vhmOd7aNiuR3nk]{Effect: Diabolic Blood Magic (Self)}

entries.name: Bloodline: Draconic
entries.description:
The blood of dragons flows through your veins. These beasts are both fearsome in combat and skilled at magic

Spell List arcane

Bloodline Skills Arcana, Intimidation

Granted Spells cantrip @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.TVKNbcgTee19PXZR]{Shield}, 1st: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Gb7SeieEvd0pL2Eh]{True Strike}, 2nd: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Fr58LDSrbndgld9n]{Resist Energy}, 3rd: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.o6YCGx4lycsYpww4]{Haste}, 4th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.tgIhRUFtgDSELpJE]{Spell Immunity}, 5th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.forsqeofEszBNtLq]{Chromatic Wall}, 6th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.5c692cCcTDXjSEzk]{Dragon Form}, 7th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.O6VQC1Bs4aSYDa6R]{Mask of Terror}, 8th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.iL6TujgTCtRRa0Y0]{Prismatic Wall}, 9th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.fkDeKktdmbeplYRY]{Overwhelming Presence}

Bloodline Spells initial: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.K8vvrOgW4bGakXxm]{Dragon Claws}, advanced: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.JcobNl4iE9HmMYtE]{Dragon Breath}, greater: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.HWJODX2zPg5cg34F]{Dragon Wings}

Blood Magic Draconic scales grow briefly on you or one target, granting a +1 status bonus to AC for 1 round.

@Compendium[pf2e.feature-effects.FNTTeJHiK6iOjrSq]{Effect: Draconic Blood Magic}

Dragon Type

At 1st level, choose the type of dragon that influenced your bloodline. You can't change your dragon type later. This affects how some of your bloodline spells function.

The good metallic dragons and their damage types are brass (fire), bronze (electricity), copper (acid), gold (fire), and silver (cold).

The evil chromatic dragons and their damage types are black (acid), blue (electricity), green (poison), red (fire), and white (cold).

Related bloodline

Because the wyrmblessed and draconic bloodlines have similar origins, they count the same as each other for the purposes of prerequisites and access requirements.

entries.name: Bloodline: Elemental
entries.description:
A genie ancestor or some other elemental influence has imbued your blood with primal fury. This affects how your blood magic works, along with your bloodline spells and granted spells marked with an asterisk (*).

Spell List primal

Bloodline Skills Intimidation, Nature

Granted Spells cantrip @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.O9w7r4BKgPogYDDe]{Produce Flame}*, 1st: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.y6rAdMK6EFlV6U0t]{Burning Hands}*, 2nd: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Fr58LDSrbndgld9n]{Resist Energy}, 3rd: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball}*, 4th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.aqRYNoSvxsVfqglH]{Freedom of Movement}, 5th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.1K6AYGisvo9gqdhs]{Elemental Form}, 6th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.yrZA4k2VAqEP8xx7]{Repulsion}, 7th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.m2xFMNyQiUKQDRaj]{Energy Aegis}, 8th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.iL6TujgTCtRRa0Y0]{Prismatic Wall}, 9th: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.r4HLQcYwB62bTayl]{Storm of Vengeance}

Bloodline Spells initial: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.0JUOgbbFCapp3HlW]{Elemental Toss}*, advanced: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.B8aCUMCHCIMUCEVK]{Elemental Motion}, greater: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Qlp8G3knwLGhAxQ0]{Elemental Blast}*

Blood Magic Elemental energy surrounds you or a target. Either you gain a +1 status bonus to Intimidation checks for 1 round, or a target takes 1 damage per spell level. The damage is bludgeoning or fire, according to your elemental type (see below). If the spell already deals that type of damage, combine it with the spell's initial damage before determining weaknesses and resistances.

@Compendium[pf2e.feature-effects.3gGBZHcUFsHLJeQH]{Effect: Elemental Blood Magic (Self)}

Elemental Type

Choose the type of elemental that influenced your bloodline: air, earth, fire, or water.

If your element is air, you buffet your foes with powerful winds; if it's earth, you toss huge chunks of rock; if it's fire, you incinerate your foes with flame; and if it's water, you inundate your foes with torrents of water.

For fire, all marked spells deal fire damage. For other elements, they deal bludgeoning damage. You replace any existing elemental traits with the trait of the element you chose.

entries.name: Bloodline: Fey
entries.description:
Fey whimsy or a tryst in a moonlit grove put the bewitching magic of the First World into your family's bloodline.

Spell List primal

Bloodline Skills Deception, Nature

You have been blessed by a phoenix, perhaps via some magical interaction with a similarly blessed individual. Grant this new sorcerer bloodline to players who finish the Fists of the Ruby Phoenix Adventure Path. Players can then choose this bloodline for any new sorcerer characters they create for future campaigns.

entries.name: Bloodline: Undead
entries.description:
The touch of undeath runs through your blood. Your family tree might contain powerful undead, like a vampire, or perhaps you died and returned a bit different.
